member.name: T:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1
member.summary: SQL Server Repository Implementation with Full Transaction Support and Connection Pooling. Provides comprehensive data access operations for entities with support for optimistic concurrency, batch operations, SQL capture, and advanced querying capabilities.
member.typeparam: The entity type that this repository manages. Must be a class with a parameterless constructor.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.LastExecutedSql
member.summary: Gets the last SQL statement that was executed by this repository instance. Returns null if no SQL has been executed or SQL capture is disabled.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.LastExecutedSqlWithParameters
member.summary: Gets the last SQL statement with parameter values substituted that was executed by this repository instance. This provides a fully executable SQL statement with actual parameter values for debugging purposes. Returns null if no SQL has been executed or SQL capture is disabled.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.CaptureSql
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SQL statements should be captured and stored. Default value is false for performance reasons. This property is thread-safe and can be safely accessed from multiple threads.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.IncludeQueryInResults
member.summary: Gets or sets whether query results should automatically include the executed SQL statement. When true, repository operations will return IDurableResult objects containing both results and SQL. When false, repository operations return standard result types without SQL information. Default value is false for performance and backward compatibility. This property is thread-safe and can be safely accessed from multiple threads.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.MaxRowsPerBatch
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of rows to include in a single multi-row INSERT statement. SQL Server can handle large batches efficiently, default is 1000 rows.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.MaxParametersPerStatement
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of parameters per INSERT statement. SQL Server has a high limit for parameters, default is 65535.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.EnablePreparedStatementReuse
member.summary: Gets whether to use prepared statement reuse for batch operations. SQL Server benefits from prepared statement reuse.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.EnableMultiRowInsert
member.summary: Gets whether to use multi-row INSERT syntax when possible. SQL Server has excellent support for multi-row INSERT statements.

member.name: P:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerRepository`1.Settings
member.summary: Gets the repository settings used to configure the connection

member.exception: Thrown when the savepoint has been disposed
Thrown when the connection is not open

member.name: M:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerSavepoint.RollbackAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously rolls back the transaction to this savepoint. SQL Server uses ROLLBACK TRANSACTION TO savepoint_name syntax.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the operation
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous rollback operation
member.exception: Thrown when the savepoint has been disposed
Thrown when the connection is not open
Thrown when the operation is cancelled via the cancellation token

member.name: M:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerSavepoint.Release
member.summary: Releases the savepoint (no-op for SQL Server). SQL Server does not support explicit RELEASE SAVEPOINT - savepoints are automatically released when the transaction commits or when an outer savepoint is rolled back. This method exists for interface compatibility but performs no operation.
member.exception: Thrown when the savepoint has been disposed

member.name: M:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerSavepoint.ReleaseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously releases the savepoint (no-op for SQL Server). SQL Server does not support explicit RELEASE SAVEPOINT - savepoints are automatically released when the transaction commits or when an outer savepoint is rolled back. This method exists for interface compatibility but performs no operation.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the operation
member.returns: A completed task
member.exception: Thrown when the savepoint has been disposed

member.name: M:Durable.SqlServer.SqlServerSavepoint.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the savepoint. Note: SQL Server automatically releases savepoints on transaction commit, so no explicit cleanup is needed.
